content:
I think there might be some confusion again. GrubHub is a food delivery platform that partners with local restaurants to deliver prepared meals. It's not a platform for ordering ingredients or groceries.

If you're looking to order ingredients online, you might consider using a grocery delivery or curbside pickup service from a local store or a dedicated online grocery platform. Some popular options include:

1. Online grocery stores like AmazonFresh, Walmart Grocery, or Peapod.
2. Grocery delivery services like Instacart, Shipt, or FreshDirect.
3. Curbside pickup services from local stores like Kroger, Whole Foods, or Target.

These services often allow you to browse and order ingredients online, and then either have them delivered to your doorstep or pick them up at the store.

If you're looking for convenience and want to avoid going to the store, this can be a great option. Just make sure to check the availability of the ingredients you need and the delivery or pickup options in your area.

Let me know if you have any more questions or if there's anything else I can help you with!
